intro: Lobelia nipensis, commonly known as the Florida lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its small, tubular blue or purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. This herbaceous perennial typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as swamps and pine flatwoods. Lobelia nipensis is part of the Campanulaceae family and is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in wetland gardens and conservation efforts.
